for Estimating/"1 Error
Xi-an Mao
Wuhan Institute of Physics, The Chinese Academy of Sciences,
Wuhan, China
Received October 14, 1992
Abstract.
More than 200 inversion-recovery experiments on 170 in D20 have been performed
in order to make a correlation between the error in T 1 and the standard deviation in data fit-
ting. The statisfical results of T 1 show that the error limit is about 6 times as big as the stan-
dard deviation. This can be proposed as an empirical rule for estimating the precision in T 1
measurements.
Author's address:
Dr. Xi-an Mao,
Wuhan Institute of Physics, The Chinese Academy of
Sciences,
